recent.text:
Loving everything in this thread!
Welcome @ingridepure – crushing it at @netlify from day 1! https://t.co/DZWbjA7dso

Looking forward Oxford Geek Night in a couple of weeks. It is over 10 years since I last spoke there, so ordering "my usual" at the bar might not work.

I'll add my thoughts on #JAMstack to the talks about @djangoproject , Machine Learning, and @p5xjs.

https://t.co/PVAvG47VeQ

The idea of no card, chocolates, flowers, or cuddly toy from @brucel (my special Captain Wonderful) this Valentine’s Day is almost too much to bare.

I’m sorry, and don’t forget my Brucey. I’m depending on you.
😘😍😘😍😘

#NotTooProudToBeg

https://t.co/vuCMtroaMO

Really rather excited about being a part of the next @frontendunited lineup. And the tickets are remarkably good value! Especially when you consider the how impressive those webby boffins all are. Just look at this list!

👉 https://t.co/nNw2FQ8M22

RT @gill_kyle: I moved one of my projects to a new domain: https://t.co/BHu1ZNzrgD 🔥

⚡️ #JAMstack London returns on Feb 5th. ⚡️

Speaker announcement:
@thorwebdev of @stripe, will talk about building e-commerce sites on the #JAMstack with @gatsbyjs, @Netlify, and @stripe.

A few places remaining.
Waiting list is open.

👉 https://t.co/2gI7y2CSma https://t.co/9ExRlIP5jc

"Another parallel I see is how both @GitHub and @Netlify chose existing, but nascent, technologies to build upon and got in early with the hope of riding an impending wave of adoption"
